Xi Jinping:
Xi Jinping is a top political and military leader in China, who has been in power as the President of China and General Secretary of the Communist Party of China (CCP) since 2012.  His full name is Xi Jinping (习近平).  He has been working towards rejuvenation of China and playing a central role on the global stage. 

Early Life and Education:
Xi Jinping was born on June 15, 1953, in the city of Beidaihe in Shan Dong Province, China.  His father, Xi Zhongxun, was an official and later a politician.  During the political turmoil in China in the 1960s, his family faced difficulties and his father was persecuted and died.  During this time, Xi Jinping spent his childhood and youth in rural China, where he had to work in agriculture and attend school. 

Education and Career:
At a young age, he joined the Communist Party of China and studied chemical engineering at Tsinghua University.  He then held various responsibilities at different levels within the party and gradually rose through the ranks. 

As President:
In 2012, following Hu Jintao, he was elected as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China.  A year later, he took on the role of the President of China.  During his governance, he has emphasized China's progress and stability in the fields of economic reforms, environmental policies, and global diplomacy. 

Politics and Military Leadership:
Xi Jinping also serves as the Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, which means he also holds control over China's military forces. 

He has initiated an idealistic program called the 'Chinese Dream', which aims to achieve national rejuvenation and build a stronger and more prosperous country. 

During his tenure, China launched the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), which is a global economic project that positions China with greater influence in many aspects of world trade and economy. 

Criticism and Controversy:
However, under Xi Jinping's leadership, there have been increased controls on freedom, human rights, and press freedom in China, leading to widespread criticism that he must confront.

Narendra Modi:
Narendra Modi's full name is Narendra Damodardas Modi.  He was born on 17th September 1950 in Vadnagar, Mehsana district of Gujarat, India.  His father's name is Damodardas Mulchand Modi and mother's name is Hiraben.  Narendra Modi's family was very humble, and he worked at a small tea shop during his childhood.  He received education in the field of politics and started his career as a tea seller. 

Modi was attracted to politics at a young age and joined the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), a Hindu nationalist organization.  He spent several years under the guidance and values of the organization before joining the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).  In a short span of time, he emerged as a young and influential leader of the BJP. 

In 2001, he became the Chief Minister of Gujarat and was elected to this position for four terms, focusing on the state's economic development and promoting the Gujarat model of development.  However, his tenure as Chief Minister during the Gujarat riots of 2002 remains controversial and dark chapter in his career. 

In May 2014, Narendra Modi became the 14th Prime Minister of India when BJP secured a landslide victory in the general elections.  Under his administration, India witnessed significant economic changes such as the implementation of GST, Digital India campaign, Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, and the Make in India initiative. 

In 2019, he was re-elected as the Prime Minister for a second term when BJP emerged victorious in the general elections.  During his second term, he introduced some major legislations such as the abrogation of special status of Jammu and Kashmir, triple talaq bill enactment, and amendments to the land acquisition law. 

Narendra Modi is known as a skilled communicator and an active user of social media.  He is praised and criticized for his style of leadership, focus on development, and support for nationalist policies.
Joko Widodo:
Joko Widodo, also known as Jokowi, is an Indonesian politician and has been the President of Indonesia since 2014.  He was born on June 21, 1961, in the city of Solo (Surakarta) on the island of Java in Indonesia. 

He started his career as a furniture maker and later became a successful furniture businessman.  Alongside his business, Jokowi entered politics and was elected as the Mayor of Solo in 2005.  He gained popularity for his welfare projects and strong administrative skills.

In 2014, Jokowi was elected as the President of Indonesia and became the country's first president who did not come from a political dynasty. Jokowi is known for his humble demeanor, a new style of leadership in politics, and being familiar with simple living, which adds to his popularity.  Despite facing various political challenges and controversies, under his leadership, Indonesia has contributed to economic and social development success.
Mamnoon Hussain:
Mamnoon Hussain is a familiar face in the political and governmental arena of Bangladesh.  He served as the 11th President of Bangladesh from 2013 to 2018.  His full name is Muhammad Mamnoon Hussain.  He was born on July 19, 1949, in Kuliyarchar village of Meherpur Thana in Dhaka district. 

Mamnoon Hussain spent his childhood and early education during the pre-liberation war period.  He completed his B. A.  (Honors) and M. A.  (History) from Dhaka College.  He then obtained an LLB degree from the University of Dhaka.  During his university life, he became involved in politics and maintained his own identity in Bangladeshi politics.

Sheikh Hasina:
Sheikh Hasina, full name Sheikh Hasina Wazed, is a prominent politician in Bangladesh and currently the Prime Minister of the country.  She is the leader of the popular Awami League party and has been elected to this position multiple times since 1996.  She is the daughter of Bangladesh's 'Father of the Nation' Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. 

Birth:
Sheikh Hasina was born on 28th September 1947 in Tungipara, Gopalganj district of Bangladesh. 

Education:
Sheikh Hasina completed most of her education in Dhaka, first at Azimpur Girls High School and later at Dhaka University. 

Entry into Politics:
Sheikh Hasina rose to prominence in politics under the deep influence of her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.  In 1975, her father along with many members of the family were brutally killed in a military coup.  Following this incident, Sheikh Hasina lived in exile and returned to Bangladesh in 1981. 

Political Career:
After returning to Bangladesh in 1981, Sheikh Hasina took over the leadership of the Awami League party and reorganized the party.  Under her leadership, Awami League came to power in Bangladesh and she became the Prime Minister for the first time in 1996.  Since then, she has been repeatedly elected to this position. 

Tenure:
Sheikh Hasina's government has worked on economic development, education reform, healthcare improvement, initiatives for climate change mitigation, and democratic governance.  However, her tenure has been criticized for political suppression and human rights issues. 

Contribution and Recognition:
Sheikh Hasina is recognized globally as a stable face of Bangladesh on the world stage.  She has received several international and national honors, including the UNESCAP Achievement Award and the Mother Teresa Award. 

Family Life:
Sheikh Hasina married Dr.  M.  A.  Wazed Mia in 1968.  They have two children. 

Sheikh Hasina is admired for her political courage, strong leadership, and unwavering commitment to the welfare of the country.
Shinzo Abe:
**Shinzo Abe Biography**

Shinzo Abe is a renowned Japanese politician who served as the Prime Minister of Japan twice, from 2006 to 2007 and again from 2012 to 2020.  Shinzo Abe was born on September 21, 1954, in Tokyo. 

**Education and Early Life:**
Shinzo Abe comes from a well-established political family in Japan.  His father, Shintaro Abe, was a powerful politician, and his grandfather, Nobusuke Kishi, was a former Prime Minister of Japan.  Abe initially studied at Seikei High School and later pursued political science at Gakushuin University.  He then briefly studied in the United States at the University of Southern California. 

**Political Career:**
At the beginning of his political career, Abe worked as a secretary to his father and was elected to the Lower House of the Japanese Parliament in 1993.  In 2006, he was elected as the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) of Japan and became the Prime Minister of Japan the same month.  However, due to criticism on various issues and health reasons, he resigned from his position in 2007. 

In 2012, Abe returned as the leader of the LDP and became the Prime Minister of Japan again, carrying out a more robust agenda.  Under his leadership, Japan took a more active role in defense and foreign policy. 

In 2020, due to health reasons, Abe once again resigned from his position.  He was not as active in politics thereafter and tragically passed away on July 8, 2021, when he was shot by a terrorist during a planned speech. 

**Policies and Achievements:**
Shinzo Abe is primarily known for his economic policy called 'Abenomics'.  According to this policy, he endeavored to revitalize and lift Japan's economy from stagnation and deflation.  He brought changes to Japan's defense policy in the constitution, expanded the role of Japan's Self-Defense Forces, giving Japan a more active role in international relations.  Through his efforts, Japan has adhered to various bilateral and multilateral agreements in security and commerce. 

Shinzo Abe has gained recognition as one of the most influential leaders in Japan's history through his policies and actions.
Benigno Aquino III:
Benigno Aquino III, commonly known as "Noynoy Aquino," was a Filipino politician and served as the President of the Philippines from 2010 to 2016.  He was born on February 8, 1960, in Manila, Philippines.  He was the fourth child among the five children of President Corazon Aquino and the late Senator Benigno Aquino Jr. 

His father, Benigno Aquino Jr. , was an opponent of Filipino dictator Ferdinand Marcos who was assassinated in 1983 at Manila Airport.  This assassination sparked widespread protests and rebellion among the Filipino people, eventually leading to the downfall of Marcos in 1986 and the ascension of his mother, Corazon Aquino, to the presidency. 

Noynoy graduated with a degree in economics from Ateneo de Manila University in the Philippines.  He began his political career when he was elected as a congressman for Tarlac province in the House of Representatives in 1998.  In 2007, he was elected as a senator in the Philippines, and then in 2010, amidst national mourning for his mother Corazon Aquino's death, he ran for and won the presidency of the Philippines. 

During his presidency, Aquino III worked successfully in many areas, especially in economic development, social justice, and anti-corruption initiatives.  His administration's main policy was the "Straight Path" where he prioritized transparency and accountability in government affairs.  Under his leadership, the country experienced rapid economic growth after years of slow progress. 

However, there were also controversial incidents during his administration.  The deaths of 44 members of the Special Action Force in the Mamasapano clash in 2015 led to increased criticism of his administration. 

Noynoy Aquino stepped down at the end of his term in 2016 and transferred the presidency to Rodrigo Duterte.  On June 24, 2021, at the age of 61, he passed away due to complications from kidney disease.
Tr\u01b0\u01a1ng T\u1ea5n Sang:
Trương Tấn Sang is a former politician from Vietnam who served as the President of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam from 2011 to 2016.  He was born on January 21, 1949, in the Mekong Delta region of South Vietnam. 

Trương Tấn Sang was a prominent member of the Communist Party of Vietnam and held many high-ranking political positions.  His political career spanned nearly 40 years, during which he made various contributions to the development of Vietnam's economy and administration.

Recep Tayyip Erdo\u011fan:
Recep Tayyip Erdogan is a Turkish politician who has been a prominent figure in Turkish politics.  He has been leading the country as Prime Minister and later as President for many years. 

Erdogan was born on 26th February 1954 in Istanbul, Turkey, into a poor family.  He grew up and graduated from Marmara University with a degree in economics and management after completing his primary and secondary education in Imam Hatip schools. 

From a young age, he had an interest in politics, and he was associated with the Turkish youth Islamic organization 'Milli Görüş' (National Vision), also known by its Turkish acronym, AKP (Adalet ve Kalkınma Partisi).  In 1994, Erdogan was elected as the Mayor of Istanbul.  As the Mayor, he gained a reputation as a successful leader who improved the city's transportation, water supply, and other infrastructures. 

Later, Erdogan founded a new political party called the Justice and Development Party (AKP).  In 2002, AKP won a majority of seats in the national elections and Erdogan subsequently became the Prime Minister. 

As Prime Minister, he effectively managed Turkey's economy, politics, and foreign policy, transforming Turkey into a powerful and influential country in both the region and globally.  Under his leadership, Turkey follows a moderate Islamic and inclusive political strategy. 

In 2014, Erdogan was directly elected as the President of Turkey for the first time, consolidating his power and influence in this position.  After the failed coup attempt in 2016, Erdogan established a more authoritarian rule, which has led to the suppression of multi-ethnic organizations and silencing of external critics. 

Recep Tayyip Erdogan's biography is not just that of a politician; he has had a profound impact on Turkish society and global politics as well.
Hassan Rouhani:
Hassan Rouhani is a seasoned political figure, academic, and scientist from Iran.  He served as the seventh President of Iran from 2013 to 2021 over two terms. 

Early Life and Education:
Hassan Rouhani was born into a religious family in the city of Sorkheh, Semnan province, Iran, on November 12, 1948.  He started his education at a religious institution in the city of Qom, Iran.  Later, he pursued higher education in law and political science. 

Political Career:
Hassan Rouhani's political life has been closely intertwined with Iran's Islamic Revolution.  He was a founding member of the Islamic Republic Party before and after the revolution.  He has served as a member of Iran's Majlis (Parliament) for several terms and also as Secretary of the Supreme National Security Council. 

Presidency:
In 2013, Rouhani won the presidential election in Iran, succeeding then-President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.  During his presidency, he focused on improving Iran's international relations, economic development, and enhancing civil liberties.  During his tenure, Iran signed a historic nuclear agreement with six major powers in 2015, which was later abandoned by the United States in 2018. 

Education and Academic Life:
Hassan Rouhani obtained a doctoral degree in law from the University of Glasgow in Scotland.  His research focused extensively on Islamic law and constitutional law. 

Rouhani is also known as a distinguished academic, contributing to education and research in various higher education institutions in Iran. 

Rouhani's political vision is described as modern, moderate, and committed to the transparency of opinions.  While he took some risks with liberal policies during his tenure, he also made efforts to maintain harmony with conservative factions. 

Towards the end of Hassan Rouhani's presidency, the state of Iran's economy, international pressures, and internal political strategies determined that his leadership was a mix of success and failure.

Thein Sein:
Thein Sein is a Burmese politician who served as the President of the country from 2011 to 2016.  He was born on April 20, 1945 in British-ruled Burma (present-day Myanmar). 

Thein Sein started his career in the military in Myanmar.  He gradually rose through the ranks within the military and held various administrative and political positions.

In 2011, a new civilian election was held in Myanmar, where Thein Sein represented the Union Solidarity and Development Party (USDP) and became the President. Park Geun-hye:
Park Geun-hye was a South Korean politician who served as the country's president from 2013 to 2017.  She was South Korea's first female president and also one of Asia's first female presidents. 

Birth and Family Background:
Park Geun-hye was born on February 2, 1952 in South Korea.  She was the daughter of Park Chung-hee, South Korea's former military ruler and later administrator.  Her mother, Yuk, was an official in the government.  Park Chung-hee was the President of South Korea from 1963 to 1979.  Park Geun-hye was influenced by a political environment in her childhood and adolescence. 

Political Career:
In 1974, when Park Geun-hye's mother, Yuk Young-soo, was assassinated, Park stepped forward as the first lady in her father's place and played a role in national ceremonies.  Her father, Park Chung-hee, was assassinated in 1979.

Fuad Masum:

Ashraf Ghani:
Ashraf Ghani (full name: Mohammad Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai) is a former professor, World Bank official, and politician who served as the President of Afghanistan from 2014 to 2021.  He was born on May 19, 1949, in Logar Province. 

Ashraf Ghani received his early education in Kabul and went to the United States in 1967.  He completed his undergraduate studies at the American University in Beirut and later obtained Master's and Ph. D.  degrees in anthropology from Columbia University. 

Ghani later worked at the World Bank and was involved in development projects in various parts of the world.  He played a significant role in the reconstruction of his country and was appointed as the Minister of Finance of Afghanistan in 2002.

Following this, Ashraf Ghani resigned from the presidency, leaving the country, which left many disappointed and angry.  His departure marks a significant turning point in Afghanistan's history, signaling a tumultuous phase of the Taliban's resurgence and an uncertain chapter in the country's political future.

Salman of Saudi Arabia:
Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud is the King of Saudi Arabia and the head of the Saudi Arabian government.  He has been in power in Saudi Arabia since January 23, 2015. 

Birth and Childhood:
Salman bin Abdulaziz was born on December 31, 1935, in the capital of Saudi Arabia, Riyadh.  He is one of the thirty sons of the founder of Saudi Arabia, King Ibn Saud. 

Education:
Salman received his primary and secondary education in Riyadh.  He completed his higher education at a renowned private school known as Princess School.  Towards the end of his educational life, he embarked on his career as a representative in a political court established by his father. 

Political Career:

In 1955, he was appointed as the Governor of Riyadh Province and served in this position for almost five decades.  During this time, he showed special interest in various projects for the development and modernization of Riyadh.

Reign:
On January 23, 2015, following the death of his brother, King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, Salman ascended to the throne.  During his reign, he announced a comprehensive economic and social plan called Saudi Vision 2030, aimed at reducing oil dependency, enhancing economic diversification, and improving the quality of life for the people. 

As a king, Salman's reign has seen several social and economic changes in Saudi Arabia, such as granting women the right to drive, announcing various mega-economic projects, etc.  However, during this time, his government has faced international debates and criticisms regarding human rights and political repression.

King Salman has several sons and daughters, and his sons are fulfilling various duties in different regional and central positions in Saudi Arabia.

Islam Karimov:
Islam Karimov (full name: Islam Abduganiyevich Karimov) was a former Uzbek politician who served as the first President of Uzbekistan.  He was born on January 30, 1938 in Samarkand region, then part of the Soviet Union, and passed away on September 2, 2016.

Alongside the controversial politics under Islam Karimov's government, his contributions such as social development and establishment of Uzbekistan's presence in the international arena remain integral parts of his biography.
Najib Razak:
Najib Razak is a Malaysian politician who is considered as a significant figure in Malaysian politics.  His full name is Datuk Seri Mohd Najib Tun Razak, and he served as the Prime Minister of Malaysia from 2009 to 2018. 

Najib was born on 23rd July 1953 in the city of Kuala Kangsar in the state of Perak in Malaysia.  He is the eldest son of Malaysia's second Prime Minister Tun Abdul Razak Hussein.  His mother, Tun Rahah Noah, was a social worker and a prominent figure in many social initiatives. 

Najib received his education in Malaysia and the United Kingdom.  He obtained a Bachelor of Science (BSc) degree in Economics and Statistics in London.  He became involved in politics following his father's death when he started working as the Minister of Youth and Sports in Malaysia. 

His political career reached great heights, but in 2018, he faced various legal allegations related to a controversial development project (1MDB scandal) which significantly impacted his political career, leading to his defeat in the general elections. 

During his tenure as Prime Minister, Najib announced various projects in Malaysia's economy, investment, education, and social development.  However, he faced extensive criticism and opposition due to allegations of economic misconduct and lack of accountability in the 1MDB scandal. 

His social and political life has made him a complex and divisive figure in Malaysian politics.  The allegations and cases against him are still ongoing, and he is working towards his political comeback. 

Najib Razak's biography has been eventful so far, but it is not over, as his life continues to witness various events and circumstances in the political and personal spheres.
Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi:
Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi is a Yemeni politician and former president of Yemen who has been ruling the country since 2012.  He was born on September 23, 1945 in the Abyan Governorate of Yemen. 

Hadi began his career in the Yemeni armed forces and worked in conflict resolution and unity in the northern and southern regions of the country.  After the civil war in 1994, he was officially appointed as the Vice President of Yemen. 

In 2011, during the Arab Spring, a significant number of people in Yemen demanded the resignation of President Ali Abdullah Saleh.  Under pressure, Saleh transferred power to Hadi as his successor in February 2012.  Hadi's presidency began amidst instability and violent conflicts as he attempted to address the country's political instability and combat terrorism. 

In 2014, the Houthi rebels seized control of large parts of the country and eventually took over the capital Sana'a, leading to Hadi being ousted.  As a result, Hadi was forced to seek refuge in Saudi Arabia and a Saudi-led coalition intervened to restore his government. 

Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi's presidency has been marked by war, humanitarian crisis, and setbacks in democratic processes in Yemen.  He lacked empathy and international support among the Yemeni people, and became vulnerable to military power and foreign intervention.

Sushil Koirala:
Sushil Koirala (Born: August 31, 1939 - Death: February 9, 2016) was a prominent political leader in Nepal and the Prime Minister of the Nepali Congress Party.  He served as the Prime Minister of Nepal from February 10, 2014, to October 10, 2015.  He was the 37th Prime Minister of Nepal. 

Sushil Koirala was a member of the well-known Koirala family in Nepali politics.  He was the official younger brother and nephew of the former Prime Ministers of Nepal.  Sushil Koirala's political career began almost from his student life, when he actively participated in student politics.  His ancestors Krishna Prasad Koirala and Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala were also renowned in Nepali politics. 

After becoming Prime Minister in 2014, Sushil Koirala contributed to the adoption of Nepal's new constitution.  Under his leadership, Nepal promulgated a new constitution, putting an end to years of political uncertainties in Nepal. 

Although he was a notable figure in politics, he still followed a modest and principled lifestyle.  Sushil Koirala was generally known as a humble and principled person.  His death left a void in Nepal's political arena.

Vladimir Putin:
Vladimir Putin is a powerful political leader in Russia and has been a part of Russian politics since 1999.  His biography is given below:

Birth and Education:
Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin was born on October 7, 1952, in Leningrad (now St.  Petersburg), Russia.  His father, Vladimir Spiridonovich Putin, was a retired Soviet Navy worker, and his mother, Maria Ivanovna Shelomova, was a factory worker.  Putin graduated with a law degree from Leningrad State University (now St.  Petersburg State University) in 1975. 

Career:
After completing his degree, Putin joined the Soviet Secret Police, the KGB (Committee for State Security).  He worked in the KGB for about 15 years, handling secret assignments abroad, especially in East Germany.  In the early 1990s, Putin left the Soviet KGB and entered into a political career. 

Politics:
At the beginning of the 1990s, Putin worked in various key roles in the Mayor's Office of St.  Petersburg.  In August 1999, President Boris Yeltsin appointed him as the Prime Minister of Russia.  A few months later, Yeltsin resigned, and Putin became the Acting President.  In March 2000, he was elected as the full-time President in national elections. 

During his tenure as President, Putin has focused on revitalizing Russia's economy, strengthening the military, and asserting Russia's dominance on the world stage.  He served two terms as President (2000-2008 and 2012-present), and in the next four years (2008-2012), he served as the Prime Minister under President Dmitry Medvedev. 

Personal Life:
Putin married Lyudmila Shkrebneva in 1983.  The couple has two daughters, Maria and Katerina.  They divorced in 2013. 

Putin is known for his tough personality and interest in sports.  He is proficient in judo and sambo martial arts, regularly plays ice hockey, engages in fishing trips, and participates in other outdoor sports. 

However, Putin's leadership has been widely criticized.  He is often condemned for crackdowns on opposition, control over press freedom, and manipulation of election results.  On the other hand, many Russian citizens see him as a symbol of national pride who has restored Russia's power and position on the global stage.
Joachim Gauck:
Joachim Gauk, whose full name is Joachim Gauk, is a German politician and former professional pastor.  He served as the President of Germany from 2012 to 2017. 

Joachim Gauk was born on January 24, 1940 in Rostock, in the former East Germany.  He studied theology and initially worked as a Lutheran pastor.  He was involved with the opposition and social activism movements in former East Germany, such as being associated with the New Forum. 

After the fall of the East German regime in 1989-1990, Gauk entered politics in Germany's reunification.
